title: Packages pick up dependencies that are not controlled by Spack in user enviornment

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->
There are quite a few cases where I run into situation where a package picks up wrong version of dependencies in my environment. For example, `spack install font-util` runs a wrong version of `fc-cache` in `/usr/bin` to install the fonts but failed. Another example is, the configure phase of `spack install r` picks up a bunch of dependencies in my home directory that are not part of spack:

Yet another example is here https://github.com/spack/spack/issues/18749, which is relevant to a few other build issues I have seen when building python packages such as `py-scipy`.

Note that I have never specified those dependencies as external packages in the spack config file. 

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install font-util
$ spack install r
$ spack install python@3.8.5
...
```

### Error Message
